Constructor Detail

GroupLayerGL

public GroupLayerGL(GLContext ctx)
Method Detail

get

public Layer get(int index)
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Returns the layer at the specified index.

Layers are ordered in terms of their depth and will be returned in this order, with 0 being the layer on bottom.

Specified by:
get in interface GroupLayer

add

public void add(Layer layer)
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Adds a layer to the bottom of the group.

Because the Layer hierarchy is a tree, if the Layer is already a child of another GroupLayer, it will be removed before being added to this GroupLayer.

Specified by:
add in interface GroupLayer

addAt

public void addAt(Layer layer,
                  float tx,
                  float ty)
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Adds the supplied layer to this group layer, adjusting its translation (relative to this group layer) to the supplied values. This is equivalent to: 
layer.setTranslation(tx, ty);
 group.add(layer);
but is such a common operation that this helper method is provided.

Specified by:
addAt in interface GroupLayer

remove

public void remove(Layer layer)
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Removes a layer from the group.

Specified by:
remove in interface GroupLayer

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Removes all the layers from this group.

Specified by:
clear in interface GroupLayer

size

public int size()
Description copied from interface: GroupLayer
Returns the number of layers in this group.

Specified by:
size in interface GroupLayer

destroy

public void destroy()
Description copied from interface: Layer
Destroys this layer, removing it from its parent layer. Any resources associated with this layer are freed, and it cannot be reused after being destroyed. Destroying a layer that has children will destroy them as well.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Layer
Overrides:
destroy in class LayerGL

hitTestDefault

public Layer hitTestDefault(pythagoras.f.Point p)
Description copied from interface: Layer
Like Layer.hitTest(pythagoras.f.Point) except that it ignores a configured Layer.HitTester. This allows one to configure a hit tester which checks custom properties and then falls back on the default hit testing implementation.

Specified by:
hitTestDefault in interface Layer
Overrides:
hitTestDefault in class AbstractLayer
